page.title: 01The Addingtons, Northants.
page.content: Great Addington is situated in the valley of the River Nene, approximately 6 miles S.E. of Kettering in Northamptonshire. Little Addington is 1 mile south of Great Addington. Both villages, which are mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086,are surrounded by farmland devoted mainly to crop growing. The population now consists chiefly of professional people who travel away to work. Virtually no farm labourers live here now compared with 50 years ago. Few people wish to retire to live in the villages because of the lack of services. The information on the following pages will say something about the buildings, the people, the employment and the concerns of the local inhabitants in 1985.
